column1: Club de Fútbol La Nucía is a Spanish football team based in La Nucía
column2: in the autonomous community of Valencia. Founded in 1995
column3: it plays in Segunda División B – Group 3
column4: holding home games at Estadio Camilo Cano

column1: Club de Fútbol La Nucía rose from the ashes of several teams that were successively created in the city
column3: the club promoted to the first regional division for the first time
column4: returning again to that level five years later.

column1: The 2006–07 season was full of unexpected events. After qualifying to the promotion playoffs for Tercera División
column2: La Nucía was eliminated by CD Olímpic de Xàtiva (1–1 draw in the first leg and 0–1 loss in the second). During the summer
column4: Club de Fútbol Dolores forfeited its berth in the competition
column5: with La Nucía occupying its place
column6: with a first-ever promotion to the national categories.

column1: In its first season in the fourth division
column2: La Nucía finished in third position in the regular season
column3: thus qualifying for the promotion playoffs
column4: being eliminated by UD Las Palmas Atlético (1–1 at home
column5: 1–2 away loss). The team met the same fate in the following campaign
column6: being ousted by RSD Alcalá in the third round (0–2 on aggregate).

column2: La Nucía achieved their first promotion ever to the third division after beating Linares in the last round of the promotion playoffs
column3: with a latest goal in the 93rd minute. It was scored by San Julían
column4: who gave the historic promotion to the club in the last game of his entire career.
